edu.mines.jtk.dsp

Class RecursiveRectangleFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.mines.jtk.dsp.RecursiveRectangleFilter

  • public class RecursiveRectangleFilter
extends java.lang.Object
    Recursive implementation of a rectangle filter. The rectangle filter is a moving average defined by the following sum: 
    
               m
   y[i] = s * sum x[i+j]
              j=l
 
 for 0<=i<n, l<=m, and s = 1.0/(1.0+m-l).
    This recursive implementation computes 
    
   y[i] = y[i-1]+s*(x[i+m]-x[i+l-1]),
    with care taken to initialize y[0] and handle array index bounds. For long filters (large 1+m-l), this recursive implementation may be much more efficient than the more straightforward sum for each index i.
    Version:
    2006.08.13
    Author:
    Dave Hale, Colorado School of Mines

    • Constructor Detail

      • RecursiveRectangleFilter

        public RecursiveRectangleFilter(int l,
                        int m)
        Constructs a rectangle filter with specified index bounds.
        Parameters:
        l - the lower index bound in the sum; must not be greater than m.
        m - the upper index bound in the sum; must not be less than l.
